result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Avad Ladwig

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Joshua Avad Ladwig.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defense WITHDRAWS their request for a prompt disposition. Defense counsel requests an adjournment to complete a sentencing memorandum. The State does not object. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Prompt disposition has been filed. Court scheduled a plea and sentencing hearing date with parties. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer A. Bechler. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. The defendant is housed at Dodge who didn't have this matter booked for a video appearance. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition - expires 10/3/22 provided by the state
all conditions remain as previously set.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court by video, defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled to cancel the bench warrant that was previously ordered. Defendant is in custody at Dodge Correctional. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Joshua Avad Ladwig in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua Avad Ladwig appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
